reviewText: Outstanding!
yek

The Yoga Stuff: I do yoga but I'm no expert. On the off chance you're actually wanting to watch this for the yoga, this is.... eh. While the yogis are impressive in their abilities, the camera tends towards slow, extreme closeup shots panning across the body rather than displaying the full pose. To compensate, most poses are held for a pretty moderate length of time. The description says "beginning and intermediate," but I found the lack of detailed instruction and camera cuts away from the yogi to the trees or beach or whatever somewhat confusing. Some of the poses will be extremely difficult for beginners, and little guidance on alternate positions is given.
The Nude stuff: as far as nudity goes, this series is pretty PG-13: there's butts and boobs, but the camera angles are pretty careful about not showing full frontal (probably called Open Lotus Crotchasama or something, idk). The yogis may not be supermodels but they're certainly not unattractive. If you're just in this for the naked stuff, looking elsewhere on the internet is probably a better expenditure of your time and *cough* effort.
Bottom line, this is a cute novelty video, but there are much better instructional yoga videos out there to use as part of your fitness regimen, even if they are less... scenic.

I do yoga almost everyday and some days I need inspiration. This video was easy to watch and follow along. Very easy. There are clear, insightful instructions on the soundtrack to accompany a variety of poses. It had attractive yoginis and settings, the music was enjoyable, not intrusive. It started out with some simple beginning lotus and plank asanas and stretching. Perfect for someone like me who needs a bit of time to ease into it.  Some of the poses pushed a bit beyond the beginner level. The pacing felt about right too. Just when I was feeling it, there was a scenic break and some time to recover.  I don't want to strain myself, and sometimes I need a bit of a challenge. It had both. Camera positions showed off the poses to their advantage, and the thing I noticed about nude yoga is you can really see details in body placement and positioning you wouldnt see otherwise. As far as the yoginis- there was quite a variety to admire, some blonde, some of Indian descent, but all were definitely at an accomplished skill level, and a couple of them were really amazing. I wished my yoga teachers looked half as good. Basically, I felt I got more than my moneys worth and then some. If you want something to inspire you and actually get you doing yoga, this is ideal.

It's obvious the women know their yoga, too bad the director was filming the ocean waves on the beach, the water pouring from the rock garden fountain, close-ups of their faces and the annoying narrator's voice telling us to find "our happiness" or the text sayings across the models. Too many distractions for very few yoga poses. I was looking for nude yoga not a rock garden water fountain and ocean waves.
